page.title: 05VILLAGE SHOP & POST OFFICE
page.content: The present shop came into existence 14 years ago when the previous shop was converted into a bungalow and the barn next door was built onto to make the shop.It sells general groceries and wines and spirits and is also the village post office. It stands north of "the green" in Weasenham St Peter. Outside is a post box and telephone box.Thursday is pension day and the busiest day in the shop.The post office is very important in the village.It is what encourages trade in the shop.The old folks are the chief customers; younger people with cars do the bulk of their shopping in the towns.Children shop for sweets,soft drinks and ice cream.Deliveries per week are-groceries once,vegetables 3 times, bread daily.Most popular items- Frozen food-Fish fingers,Chips:Cereals Cornflakes:Biscuits Rich Tea.
